comment.text: This translation key is used to display a notification when a room's external link has been renamed. The notification will show a before-and-after comparison of the old and new link titles. It appears in the UI for the "Room External Link" feature.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "renamed to" is not accurately reflected in the Azerbaijani translation. "olaraq dəyişdirildi" translates to "was changed to", which implies a more general change rather than a specific renaming.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a more direct translation for 'renamed to', such as "yenidən adlandırıldı" or "adını dəyişdirilmişdir".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English uses <1>«{{...}}</1> for the link titles. The Azerbaijani translation mirrors this formatting but it's crucial to ensure this formatting is consistently applied and correct for the target platform or system.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify that the formatting '<1>«{{...}}</1>' is appropriate and consistent with the intended display system for Azerbaijani.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Italian translation "rinominato" directly translates to "renamed". However, in Italian, it's more natural and idiomatic to use a phrasing like "è stato rinominato" or "è diventato".
The closing quote mark for `{{linkTitle}}` is a full-width character (”）) instead of a half-width character (”).
The English phrase 'renamed to' is translated as '링크의 이름이... 변경되었습니다' which is a bit too verbose. A more natural Korean translation would be something like '로 변경되었습니다' or '로 바뀌었습니다'.

The `<1>«{{oldLinkTitle}}»</1>` and `<1>«{{linkTitle}}»</1>` formatting is preserved exactly as in the English. While technically correct, this might look unnatural in Korean and could be streamlined depending on the surrounding UI.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider simplifying the formatting to match Korean UI conventions (e.g., removing the `<1>` tags if unnecessary or adjusting the spacing). This suggestion depends on the broader UI design.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'renamed to' is not directly equivalent to 'została zmieniona na'. While 'została zmieniona na' conveys a similar meaning, it's more formal and verbose than 'renamed to'. A more accurate and natural translation might be 'przemianowano na'.
The use of 'Nazwa linku' implies a focus on the *name* of the link. While technically correct, it might be more natural to simply say 'Link'.
The phrase 'renamed to' is not accurately conveyed. 'leas natama karana ladi' literally translates to 'was named' which implies a single event, not a renaming.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a phrase that specifically indicates renaming, such as 'leas natama karanawa' (was renamed) or a more descriptive phrasing if possible without exceeding length constraints.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` tags should be consistent with the English content. They appear correct but double-check that the translator is using the intended formatting system.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Confirm that the `<1>` tags are used consistently throughout the application and adhere to established conventions.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Bağlantı <1>«{{oldLinkTitle}}»</1> <1>«{{linkTitle}}»</1> olarak yeniden adlandırıldı" is a literal translation and sounds unnatural in Turkish. A more natural phrasing would be something like "<1>«{{oldLinkTitle}}»</1> bağlantısı <1>«{{linkTitle}}»</1> olarak yeniden adlandırıldı" or "<1>«{{oldLinkTitle}}»</1> adlı bağlantı <1>«{{linkTitle}}»</1> olarak yeniden adlandırıldı".
